result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake Justin Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
JOC amended 09-30-2019: Probation extended for 2 years or until programming and financial obligations paid in full.
Meet with DOC representative within 48 hours.

miscConds.notes: Fine and court costs totaling $550.60.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Restitution and surcharges totaling $5,650.07.  Minimum payment of $25.00 per week on restitution owed.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.
Defendant is to undergo any counseling as recommended by Agent.    Cognitive Behavior Class as directed by DOC agent.

No contact with John Galligan or Northland Lawn & Sport.  No contact with Wayne Nelson or his properties.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or drugs, except for medications as prescribed by a physician and taken only as prescribed.     Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and no consumption of illegal drugs.   As a convicted felon, prohibited from voting until civil rights restored.
Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

Minutes Filed
Minutes Filed
Minutes Filed
Exhibit #1 and #2
Minutes Filed

Defendant Blake Justin Mueller in court with attorney Linda Irene Coleman.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Exhibits #1 and #2 marked prior to hearing.  PH and MH being heard.  PH will be heard first.
Deputy Andy Mika sworn and questioned by DA Bourg.  09-05-2015 working for BCSD; called about break in at Northland Lawn & Sports on Hwy 63 in Bayfield County; met with owners; reviews exhibit #1-DA moves for admit of exhibit #1; Court receives exhibit #1 with no obj.  Cross by Atty Coleman.  No re-direct; witness excused.
Detective Scott Morland sworn and questioned by DA Bourg.  Witness identifies defendant; burglaries in both Ashland and Bayfield Counties being investigated; interviewed Mr. Mueller at the A.C. jail after search warrant issued by Judge Eaton, Mr. Mueller taken into custody on 10-13-2015; explains to the Court the Miranda procedure used; admitted he did the burglary at Northland Lawn & Sports, explaining what he did, and amount of money taken; witness reviews exhibit #2-investigative report; footprint left behind at the scene at Northland Lawn & Sports and matched A.C. burglary sites.  Cross by Atty Coleman; worked on the A.C. and City of Ashland cases for months; obtained warrant for Mr. Mueller's cell; obtained warrant for Mr. Mueller's car; obtained warrant for Mr. Mueller's DNA; obtained warrant for other items that may have been used for the burglaries; performed interrogation of Mr. Mueller; did show the police report to Mr. Mueller.  Re-direct by DA Bourg; he was informed of Miranda rights, he agreed to answer questions; knew of Mr. Mueller's criminal history in 2008 cases; previous convictions for burglary; Mr. Mueller did not ask for an attorney on 10-13-2015; he did ask for an attorney in the subsequent interview.  Re-cross by Atty Coleman; learned from CI that the money was used to by herion; was informed by Mr. Mueller's girlfriend that the money was hidden in Mr. Mueller's vehicle during a debrief in June, 2016.  No Re-direct by DA.  No further witnesses.
Argument by DA Bourg on PH.  Argument by Atty Coleman on PH and Motion to Suppress.  Rebuttal argument by DA Bourg.
Court reviews exhibits; Suppression issue, waiver made in standard process based on evidence today; information was provided regarding right to have attorney, defendant did not indicate he wanted attorney at any time during the interrogation; statements made knowingly and voluntarily, not subject to suppression.  Satisfied based on evidence today that there is probably cause to bind defendant over for further proceedings.  
DA Bourg files information with the Court.  Atty Coleman rec'd copy of information-waive reading and stands mute.  Court; NG pleas entered.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for witness to appear and give evidence on June 28, 2016 at 8:45 a.m. issued to A.M.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for witness to appear and give evidence on June 28, 2016 at 8:45 a.m. issued to S.M.
Minutes Filed
Scheduling conference on June 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's notice of motion and motion to suppress statements
Letter from Atty. Bourg regarding preliminary hearing
